document_data.name: Mouse
document_data.refs1e: {{Cite dragon/60/More Cantrips: Mini-spells for apprentice magic-users|19}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''Mouse''''' was a personal [[cantrip]] that initiate [[wizard]]s could learn.{{Cite dragon/59/Cantrips: Minor magics for would-be wizards|6}} It summoned a common, normal-sized [[mouse]] to a nearby location chosen by the caster.
document_data.Effects: This cantrip conjured a single common field mouse or a closely related species from the surrounding area. It appeared at a spot within {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}}The original description of this spell in [[Dragon magazine 60|''Dragon'' #60]] used the 1{{st}}-edition nomenclature 1", meaning {{SI|10|ft}} indoors and {{SI|10|yd}} outdoors. This was simplified to the shorter range in ''[[Wizard's Spell Compendium Volume Four]]''. of the caster. The caster had no control over the rodent, and it behaved as a creature was inclined to do in the circumstances in which it found itself.
document_data.Components: This cantrip required [[verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s to cast. The caster placed both hands on the head, angled to mimic mouse ears, and spoke the name of a food item preferred by mice.
